metadata.title: CVE-2021-42717 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: ModSecurity 3.x through 3.0.5 mishandles excessively nested JSON objects.Crafted JSON objects with nesting tens-of-thousands deep could result inthe web server being unable to service legitimate requests. Even amoderately large (e.g., 300KB) HTTP request can occupy one of the limitedNGINX worker processes for minutes and consume almost all of the availableCPU on the machine. Modsecurity 2 is similarly vulnerable: the affectedversions include 2.8.0 through 2.9.4.

criterions.comment: modsecurity-apache: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
